intro: Ctenitis erythradenia, commonly known as the red-stemmed hakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal areas and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and narrow, leathery leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Ctenitis erythradenia is well adapted to arid and coastal environments, showing resilience to drought and salt spray.
